item.title: Interview with Author Jeremy McAnally
item.dc:creator: Victor Goff
item.content:encoded:
Interview: Author Jeremy McAnally

by Satish Talim on May 13, 2009 ¬∑ 0 comments
<script type="text/javascript"> </script> <script src="http://pagead2.googlesyndication.com/pagead/show_ads.js" type="text/javascript"> </script>
Our Book Promotion: ‚ÄúRuby in Practice‚Äù starts soon. Win one of four books to be given out for participation. The coolest thing? Author Jeremy McAnally will be on site to answer questions! Click here for more details. Here, in this brief interview, Satish Talim of RubyLearning talks to Jeremy McAnally.

Satish>> Jeremy, could you tell us something about yourself - your background, where you are based?
Jeremy>> I‚Äôm Jeremy McAnally. I‚Äôve been developing software for about 8 years now, bouncing from VB3 (16-bit, w00t!) to PHP to C# to Python to Ruby and beyond working on a really wide array of projects. I‚Äôm currently based in Huntsville, AL.

¬†Read the rest of the interview here!
